Q.01.question: When you "move forward," which sensation feels closest to what arises within you?

A.text: A feeling of being pushed upward by something beneath the ground

B.text: A sense that the path ahead is illuminated, and you think "that's it"

C.text: An impression of being led by the hand by someone

D.text: You realize you've already been moving, and the meaning becomes clear later

Q.02.question: In the moment you sense a "self" you have yet to discover, what comes most naturally to you?

A.text: Trying to interpret the structure and meaning

B.text: Feeling a nostalgia akin to deja vu

C.text: Remembering a self you had forgotten

D.text: Your body reacts first, and thought catches up later

Q.03.question: When you are not understood, what kind of feeling lingers in your heart?

A.text: Thinking there was a problem with how you communicated

B.text: Feeling bewildered by the gap in values

C.text: Sensing that there was a wall protecting yourself

D.text: Feeling an invisible disconnect

Q.04.question: Which moment from your past has left the strongest impression?

A.text: A tense moment when you made a critical decision

B.text: A moment when you felt you had "moved forward" despite having no rational explanation

C.text: When you felt a deep bond with someone

D.text: A puzzling scene whose meaning only became clear afterward

Q.05.question: When someone tells you "only you can do this," which inner response is closest to yours?

A.text: Feeling puzzled and questioning back, "Why me?"

B.text: Straightening your back, feeling you must live up to the expectation

C.text: Feeling joy and the weight of responsibility at the same time

D.text: Quietly accepting the irreplaceability of yourself

Q.06.question: When your consciousness is deeply immersed, when do you feel most like yourself?

A.text: When you are focused on pursuing a goal

B.text: When a quiet sense of acceptance is spreading within you

C.text: When you feel the sensation of collaborating with someone

D.text: When your body moves first, and meaning surfaces afterward

Q.07.question: When no one is watching, where does your heart gravitate?

A.text: The impulse to take a step forward

B.text: Constructing logical reasoning

C.text: Imagining someone else's reaction

D.text: Listening to the voice within your heart

Q.08.question: How do you most often perceive the world?

A.text: Dynamic, as if you are being propelled forward

B.text: Lucid, with a clear and orderly path visible

C.text: Multi-layered, with relationships to those around you emerging

D.text: Deep and still, where the meaningless begins to carry meaning

Q.09.question: If asked "why are you here, right now, in this moment?"

A.text: Timing and chance led me here

B.text: I chose this because I felt it had meaning

C.text: I feel I am following someone's will or the flow of things

D.text: There is no reason, but it was meant to be

Q.10.question: If you were to compare your life to a single painting, what would characterize it?

A.text: Advancing while spiraling, like a helix

B.text: An impression like a blueprint drawn with lines

C.text: Multiple layers overlapping one another

D.text: Its meaning is unclear at first glance, yet it draws you in

Q.11.question: What sensation is closest to what "conviction" feels like for you?

A.text: It arrives when all the logic falls into place

B.text: A feeling of a single axis passing cleanly through your core

C.text: It emerges when your sense aligns with another person's

D.text: You cannot explain why, but you feel absolutely certain

Q.12.question: When you feel you want to "begin" something, what flips the switch for you?

A.text: When the reason becomes clear

B.text: When you notice your body is already leaning forward

C.text: When a surge of energy arises between you and someone else

D.text: When something wells up naturally from deep within you

Q.13.question: When do someone else's words cut deeply into you?

A.text: When your reasoning is challenged or denied

B.text: When someone closes the emotional distance with you

C.text: When someone touches a part of you that even you were unaware of

D.text: When the atmosphere or silence of a moment affects you more than the words themselves

Q.14.question: When you are thinking alone in a quiet room, what kind of thought process unfolds?

A.text: Organizing key points while considering your own position

B.text: Reflecting on the flow of events and the context behind them

C.text: Replaying relationships with others and the movement of emotions

D.text: Wordless impressions and sensations drifting through you

Q.15.question: When do you most strongly feel your own "growth"?

A.text: When you have overcome a challenge and produced results

B.text: When you realize you have continued making choices by your own will

C.text: After an experience of deeply connecting with someone

D.text: When you clearly sense a transformation, though you cannot explain it

Q.16.question: Which of the following words is closest to your sense of "will"?

A.text: Reason

B.text: Gravity

C.text: Resonance

D.text: Silence

Q.17.question: When someone misunderstands you, which response is closest to your first reaction?

A.text: Trying to explain yourself again

B.text: Reflecting on why your message did not get through

C.text: Imagining the other person's background and emotions

D.text: Listening to the trembling within yourself

Q.18.question: In what form does your "hesitation" most often manifest?

A.text: Being unable to decide while comparing options

B.text: Being unable to move forward despite having all the reasons in place

C.text: Being unable to commit because you worry about someone's reaction

D.text: The meaning within you has not yet fully solidified

Q.19.question: If there were a "landscape" within your inner self, what would it be?

A.text: A city arranged in geometric patterns

B.text: A wilderness with a path of light stretching into the distance

C.text: A water surface rippling like a mirror

D.text: Silhouettes floating within an endless fog

Q.20.question: When you made a truly profound choice, what was present in that moment?

A.text: Logic and coherence

B.text: A feeling that the only option was to move forward

C.text: A resonance with someone else's feelings

D.text: A quiet conviction known only to yourself

Q.21.question: When your "true desire" takes shape, what does it feel like?

A.text: It is supported by consistent logic and context

B.text: A clear sense of direction is moving your body

C.text: It overlaps with the feeling of being connected heart-to-heart with someone

D.text: You cannot put it into words, yet somehow it remains unshakable

Q.22.question: Which moment comes closest to when you strongly felt "this was my own choice"?

A.text: It was the most structurally rational option

B.text: Your body responded without hesitation

C.text: Someone else's feelings were aligned with yours

D.text: Even without being able to explain it, you felt a deep inner acceptance

Q.23.question: When do you become aware of your "true feelings"?

A.text: After you have finished organizing your thoughts

B.text: When emotions you had been holding back overflow

C.text: When someone's words act as a trigger

D.text: When tears come for no apparent reason

Q.24.question: Late at night, unable to sleep, which image comes closest to what floats into your mind?

A.text: Organizing plans for tomorrow and the future

B.text: An urge to get up and act right now

C.text: The lingering sensation of an exchange with someone

D.text: Afterimages of a dream whose meaning even you do not understand

Q.25.question: Finally, which of the following is closest to what "resides deep within you"?

A.text: A conviction grounded in reason

B.text: An impulse toward a single movement

C.text: A memory of having truly connected with someone

D.text: A presence that exists before language
